Description: Before European colonization, the Raleigh area was home to indigenous tribes including the Tuscarora and Occaneechi. Sir Walter Raleigh, among others, funded a group of colonists to establish the Cittie of Raleigh. These colonists landed on Roanoke Island in 1587 and later became known as the "Lost Colony" after the settlement was found abandonded in 1590. In 1770 the General Assembly created Wake County. In 1792, Raleigh was founded as the state capital of North Carolina.
